title: Nerja & Costa del Sol at a glance
summary: The eastern Costa del Sol, centred around the charming town of Nerja, offers a more authentic Spanish experience than the high-rise resorts further west. Here, rugged cliffs meet sandy coves, and the whitewashed villages of the Axarquía mountains provide a stunning backdrop to your Mediterranean holiday.
whoItSuits: Families looking for safe, sandy beaches and relaxed dining.
Couples seeking romantic sunset spots and authentic Spanish charm.
Outdoor enthusiasts who enjoy coastal hikes and mountain trails.
gettingThere: The nearest gateway is Málaga Airport (AGP), approximately 50 minutes' drive from Nerja. Most international airlines operate daily flights from major UK and European cities.
gettingAround: Whilst Nerja itself is very walkable, hiring a car is highly recommended to explore the hidden coves and mountain villages like Frigiliana and Competa.
bestTimeToVisit: May to June and September to October offer perfect temperatures for exploring. July and August are the hottest months, ideal for dedicated beach lovers.
goodToKnow: Most shops observe a traditional siesta between 2pm and 5pm. Tapas is often served free with drinks in many local bars in the Axarquía region.

itineraries.title: A Perfect 3 Days in Nerja
bullets: Day 1: Breakfast at Balcón de Europa, lunch at Burriana Beach, and a sunset stroll.
Day 2: Morning visit to the Nerja Caves, afternoon in the hilltop village of Frigiliana.
Day 3: Coastal hike to Maro beach and a farewell seafood dinner at the Plaza de los Cangrejos.

itineraries.title: The 7-Day Relax & Explore Itinerary
bullets: Days 1-3: Settle into Nerja, beach time, and local town exploration.
Day 4: Day trip to Málaga city for the Picasso Museum and the Alcazaba.
Day 5: Drive through the Axarquía mountains and try local sweet wine in Competa.
Day 6: Boat trip along the Maro-Cerro Gordo cliffs.
Day 7: Last-minute souvenir shopping and a long Spanish 'sobremesa' lunch.
